thread.title: NHL Preview: Team-by-team analysis of the 2015-16 season
thread.title_full: NHL Preview: Team-by-team analysis of the 2015-16 season

author: Dave Molinari / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: NHL Preview: Team-by-team analysis of the 2015-16 season
text:
NHL Preview: Team-by-team analysis of the 2015-16 season Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 12 hrs ago By Dave Molinari / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette © Matt Freed/Post-Gazette Dave Molinari predicts Sidney Crosby and the Penguins to finish third in the Eastern Conference Metropolitan Division this season. Penguins beat writer Dave Molinari previews the upcoming NHL season with at what to expect for every team. Teams are listed in predicted order of finish.
AdChoices EASTERN CONFERENCE
Metropolitan Division
1. WASHINGTON CAPITALS
Coach: Barry Trotz.
2014-15 record: 45-26-11.
Key newcomers: RW T.J. Oshie, RW Justin Williams, D Taylor Chorney.
Key departures: C Eric Fehr, D Mike Green, LW Curtis Glencross, D Tim Gleason, RW Troy Brouwer, RW Joel Ward, D John Erskine.
Overview: If there’s a shutdown in Washington this winter, it won’t have anything to do with the Capitals offense.
2. NEW YORK ISLANDERS
Coach: Jack Capuano.
2014-15 record: 47-28-7.
Key newcomers: D Marek Zidlicky, G Thomas Greiss, RW Steve Bernier.
Key departures: D Griffin Reinhart, D Lubomir Visnovsky, G Michael Neuvirth, RW Michael Grabner, RW Colin McDonald.
Overview: Relocating to Brooklyn might not be the Islanders’ only big move this season.
3. PITTSBURGH PENGUINS
Coach: Mike Johnston.
2014-15 record: 43-27-12.
Key newcomers: RW Phil Kessel, C Nick Bonino, C Matt Cullen, LW Sergei Plotnikov, RW Daniel Sprong, D Adam Clendening, C Eric Fehr.
Key departures: D Paul Martin, C Brandon Sutter, D Christian Ehrhoff, LW Nick Spaling, RW Steve Downie, LW Blake Comeau.
Overview: Bet the over.
Loading...
4. COLUMBUS BLUE JACKETS
Coach: Todd Richards.
2014-15 record: 42-35-5.
Key newcomers: LW Brandon Saad, C Gregory Campbell.
Key departures: C Artem Anisimov, C Mark Letestu, LW Marko Dano, LW Jeremy Morin.
Overview: With Saad in the mix, the Blue Jackets’ forwards might outscore Ohio State’s football team.
5. NEW YORK RANGERS
Coach: Alain Vigneault.
2014-15 record: 53-22-7.
Key newcomers: C Jarret Stoll, RW Emerson Etem, LW Viktor Stalberg, G Antti Rannta, C Oscar Lindberg.
Key departures: LW Carl Hagelin, RW Martin St. Louis, G Cam Talbot, D Matt Hunwick.
Overview: Even a small step back during regular season could drop Rangers several spots in this hyper-competitive division.
6. PHILADELPHIA FLYERS
Coach: Dave Hakstol.
2014-15 record: 33-31-8.
Key newcomers: C Sam Gagner, G Michal Neuvirth, D Evgeny Medvedev.
Key departures: D Nicklas Grossmann, C Zac Rinaldo, D Carlo Colaiacovo, G Ray Emery, D Andrew MacDonald (on waivers).
Overview: Flyers finally have a blueprint for building a true contender, assuming they have the patience to stick with it.
7. NEW JERSEY DEVILS
Coach: John Hynes.
2014-15 record: 32-36-14.
Key newcomers: LW Jiri Tlusty, C Pavel Zacha, RW Kyle Palmieri, D David Schlemko, D John Moore, RW Lee Stempniak, C Sergey Kalinin.
Key departures: C Scott Gomez, D Bryce Salvador, RW Michael Ryder, RW Dainius Zubrus, G Scott Clemmensen.
Overview: Ray Shero has taken on another major rebuild, this time without a Crosby-Malkin foundation.
8. CAROLINA HURRICANES
Coach: Bill Peters.
2014-15 record: 30-41-11.
Key newcomers: G Eddie Lack, D Noah Hanifin, RW Kris Versteeg, D James Wisniewski, C Joakim Nordstrom.
Key departures: RW Alex Semin, RW Patrick Dwyer, G Anton Khudobin.
Overview: The players Carolina will count on most to win games early in the season are the ones who will be dealt away by the trade deadline.
***
Atlantic Division
1. TAMPA BAY LIGHTNING
Coach: Jon Cooper.
2014-15 record: 50-24-8.
Key newcomers: RW Eric Condra, G Kevin Poulin.
Key departures: LW Brenden Morrow, D Mark Barberio.
Overview: Lightning trying to become first team to appear in back-to-back Stanley Cup finals since 2009.
2. DETROIT RED WINGS
Coach: Jeff Blashill.
2014-15 record: 43-25-14.
Key newcomers: C Dylan Larkin, D Mike Green, C Brad Richards.
Key departures: D Marek Zidlicky, C Stephen Weiss.
Overview: Red Wings crank out speedy, skilled young players like a Detroit assembly line.
3. MONTREAL CANADIENS
Coach: Michel Therrien.
2014-15 record: 50-22-10.
Key newcomers: RW Alexander Semin, LW Tomas Fleischmann, G Mike Condon, RW Zack Kassian (suspended).
Key departures: LW Brandon Prust, D Sergei Gonchar, D Mike Weaver, C Manny Malhotra, RW P.A. Parenteau, G Dustin Tokarski (on waivers).
Overview: With Carey Price and P.K. Subban on hand, Therrien’s shelf life shows no signs of nearing its expiration date.
4. OTTAWA SENATORS
Coach: Dave Cameron.
2014-15 record: 43-26-13.
Key newcomers: None.
Key Departures: RW Eric Condra, D Eric Gryba, G Robin Lehner, C David Legwand.
Overview: Senators have to prove their late-season surge into the 2015 playoffs was as legit as it looked.
5. FLORIDA PANTHERS
Coach: Gerard Gallant.
2014-15 record: 38-29-15.
Key newcomers: RW Reilly Smith, C Connor Brickley.
Key departures: RW Jimmy Hayes, LW Brad Boyes, C Tomas Kopecky, LW Scottie Upshall, G Dan Ellis, D Shane O’Brien.
Overview: It’s unclear how many people in south Florida have noticed, but the Panthers have become a playoff-caliber team.
6. BOSTON BRUINS
Coach: Claude Julien.
2014-15 record: 41-27-14.
Key newcomers: LW Matt Belesky, RW Jimmy Hayes, C Zac Rinaldo, G Jonas Gustavsson, D Colin Miller, C Joonas Kemppainen.
Key departures: LW Milan Lucic, D Dougie Hamilton, C Carl Soderberg, RW Reilly Smith, D Matt Bartkowski, LW Daniel Paille, C Max Talbot (on waivers).
Overview: It probably won’t be much consolation to the Bruins that they’ll win more games than the Patriots.
7. BUFFALO SABRES
Coach: Dan Bylsma.
2014-15 record: 23-51-8.
Key newcomers: C Jack Eichel, D Cody Franson, G Robin Lehner, C Ryan O’Reilly, LW Jamie McGinn, C David Legwand, D Matt Donovan, D Carlo Colaiacovo.
Key departures: C Mikhail Grigorenko, D Andrej Meszaros, D Nikita Zadorov, C Cody Hodgson, G Anders Lindback, D Andre Benoit.
Overview: Sabres won’t get near the playoffs, but finally will have a season that isn’t like going over Niagara Falls in a barrel.
8. TORONTO MAPLE LEAFS
Coach: Mike Babcock.
2014-15 record: 30-44-8.
Key newcomers: C Shawn Matthias, RW P.A. Parenteau, D Scott Harrington, LW Brad Boyes, RW Michael Grabner, LW Daniel Winnik, C Mark Arcobello, LW Nick Spaling, D Matt Hunwick, D Martin Marincin.
Key departures: RW Phil Kessel, D Tim Erixon, D Eric Brewer, LW Colton Orr, C Zach Sill.
Overview: Maple Leafs’ talent in the front office is much better than it is on the ice, at least for now.
***
WESTERN CONFERENCE
Central Division
1. ST. LOUIS BLUES
Coach: Ken Hitchcock.
2014-15 record: 51-24-7.
Key newcomers: RW Troy Brouwer, C Kyle Brodziak, C Robby Fabbri, LW Scottie Upshall.
Key departures: RW T.J. Oshie, D Barret Jackman, C Olli Jokinen, D Zbynek Michalek, C Marcel Goc, LW Chris Porter.
Overview: Nothing the Blues accomplish during the regular season would compensate for another early playoff exit.
2. MINNESOTA WILD
Coach: Mike Yeo.
2014-15 record: 46-28-8.
Key newcomers: D Mike Reilly, LW Chris Porter.
Key departures: LW Matt Cooke, C Kyle Brodziak, RW Chris Stewart, D Jonathan Blum, D Keith Ballard, RW Sean Bergenheim, D Jordan Leopold.
Overview: Wild is slowly, steadily developing into a genuine contender.
3. CHICAGO BLACKHAWKS
Coach: Joel Quenneville.
2014-15 record: 48-28-6
Key newcomers: C Artem Anisomov, D Trevor Daley, LW Artemi Panarin, RW Viktor Tikhonov, LW Ryan Garbutt.
Key departures: LW Brandon Saad, LW Patrick Sharp, D Johnny Oduya, C Antoine Vermette, LW Kris Versteeg, G Antti Raanta, D Kimmo Timonen.
Overview: Happily for the rest of the league, the Blackhawks haven’t shown they can win Cups in consecutive years. Yet.
4. NASHVILLE PREDATORS
Coach: Peter Laviolette.
2014-15 record: 47-25-10.
Key newcomers: C Cody Hodgson, RW Cody Bass.
Key departures: C Matt Cullen, D Cody Franson, LW Viktor Stalberg, C Mike Santorelli.
Overview: Predators sometimes can be easy to overlook, until you check the top half of the standings.
5. DALLAS STARS
Coach: Lindy Ruff.
2014-15 record: 41-31-10.
Key newcomers: RW Patrick Sharp, D Johnny Oduya, G Antti Niemi, C Mattias Janmark.
Key departures: D Trevor Daley, C Shawn Horcoff, G Jhonas Enroth, LW Ryan Garbutt.
Overview: Stars have the potential to be one of the most pleasant surprises in the league.
6. WINNIPEG JETS
Coach: Paul Maurice.
2014-15 record: 43-26-13.
Key newcomers: C Alex Burmistrov, C Nic Petan, RW Nikolaj Ehlers, C Andew Copp.
Key departures: LW Michael Frolik, RW Lee Stempniak, LW Jiri Tlusty, C Jim Slater, D Jay Harrison (on waivers).
Overview: It will be a cold day in Manitoba when … anything happens.
7. COLORADO AVALANCHE
Coach: Patrick Roy.
2014-15 record: 39-31-12.
Key newcomers: LW Blake Comeau, D Francois Beauchemin, C Carl Soderberg, D Nikita Zadorov, C Mikhail Grigorenko, RW Mikko Rantanen, C Jesse Winchester, D Brandon Gormley, LW Curtis Glencross (tryout), RW Jack Skille (tryout).
Key departures: C Ryan O’Reilly, RW Daniel Briere, LW Jamie McGinn, C Jan Hejda, RW Jordan Caron.
Overview: The Avalanche has some outstanding young talent. Just not enough to be a factor yet.
***
Pacific Division
1. ANAHEIM DUCKS
Coach: Bruce Boudreau.
2014-15 record: 51-24-7.
Key newcomers: LW Carl Hagelin, D Kevin Bieska, G Anton Khudobin, C Shawn Horcoff, RW Chris Stewart, C Mike Santorelli, D Shane O’Brien.
Key departures: RW Emerson Etem, LW Matt Beleskey, D Francois Beauchemin, RW Kyle Palmieri, D James Wisniewski.
Overview: These Ducks just might get a real Disney ending to their season.
2. LOS ANGELES KINGS
Coach: Darryl Sutter.
2014-15 record: 40-27-15.
Key newcomers: LW Milan Lucic, D Christian Ehrhoff, G Jhonas Enroth.
Key departures: C Mike Richards, D Robyn Regehr, C Jarret Stoll, D Slava Voynov, RW Justin Williams, G Martin Jones, D Andrej Sekera, D Jamie McBain (on waivers).
Overview: If the other team from southern California doesn’t win the Stanley Cup, this one might.
3. CALGARY FLAMES
Coach: Bob Hartley.
2014-15 record: 45-30-7.
Key newcomers: D Dougie Hamilton, LW Michael Frolik.
Key departures: D Raphael Diaz, RW Brian McGrattan, LW Mason Raymond (on waivers), C Paul Byron (on waivers).
Overview: Flames might be a bit better this season, but they can’t be any more entertaining than in 2014-15.
4. SAN JOSE SHARKS
Coach: Pete DeBoer.
2014-15 record: 40-33-9.
Key newcomers: D Paul Martin, RW Joel Ward, G Martin Jones.
Key departures: G Antti Niemi, D Scott Hannan, LW John Scott, D Matt Irwin.
Overview: Perhaps the Sharks will finally do something big, now that they’re not expected to.
5. VANCOUVER CANUCKS
Coach: Willie Desjardins.
2014-15 record: 48-29-5.
Key newcomers: C Brandon Sutter, LW Brandon Prust, D Matt Bartkowski, C Jared McCann, RW Jake Virtanen, RW Adam Cracknell.
Key departures: C Nick Bonino, G Eddie Lack, D Kevin Bieksa, LW Zack Kassian, C Shawn Matthias, D Adam Clendening.
Overview: At least the Canucks get to work in one of North American’s most spectacular cities.
6. EDMONTON OILERS
Coach: Todd McLellan.
2014-15 record: 24-44-14.
Key newcomers: C Connor McDavid, G Cam Talbot, D Griffin Reinhart, C Mark Letestu, D Andrej Sekera, D Eric Gryba, LW Lauri Korpikoski, D Dillon Simpson, G Anders Nilsson, LW Anton Slepyshev.
Key departures: C Derek Roy, C Boyd Gordon, G Viktor Fasth.
Overview: McDavid will lead the Oilers to some great times, but they won’t get there just yet.
7. ARIZONA COYOTES
Coach: Dave Tippett.
2014-15 record: 24-50-8.
Key newcomers: C Max Domi, LW Anthony Duclair, D Nicklas Grossmann, RW Steve Downie, C Boyd Gordon, D Zbynek Michalek, C Antoine Vermette, RW Brad Richardson.
Key departures: C Sam Gagner, D John Moore, LW Martin Erat, LW Lauri Korpokoski, C Marc Arcobello.
Overview: Coyotes unlikely to contend for anything except the draft rights to super-prospect Auston Matthews, an Arizona native.
Dave Molinari: dmolinari@post-gazette.com and Twitter @MolinariPG.
